ETYMOLOGY: From Old English sēocness 'disease, infirmity,' from sēoc 'sick' + -ness.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The state of being ill or unwell; illness.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He took a day off work due to a sudden sickness.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他因突发疾病而请了一天假。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A specific disease or disorder, often implying a less severe or common condition than 'disease.'
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 特指某种疾病或不适，常指比“疾病”更轻微或常见的病症。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Motion sickness can make long journeys very difficult.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 晕动病会使长途旅行变得非常困难。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The feeling of nausea or an urge to vomit; vomiting.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 恶心感或呕吐的冲动；呕吐。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The strong odor caused a feeling of sickness.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那股强烈的气味引起了恶心感。

REGISTER: Commonly used in everyday conversation and medical contexts.
